definition: to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: At present, "striking bricks" is a popular expression on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 如今，“拍砖”一词在网上十分流行。

sentences.english: Welcome to explore, accept the challenge.
As a result some people get annoyed, and the flaming and trolling begin.
sentences.chinese: 于是有些人就恼了，挖坑和拍砖就开始了。

definition: to point out mistakes or weak points for correction/to comment/criticism
darlings/fans/followers/short form of 親愛的們|亲爱的们
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
impression or feeling after visiting or watching (movies, museums etc)
to reply to an invitation/(Internet) to post a comment on a forum topic
to use an image without permission
